image.altText: A tanned Aboriginal woman walking with a white man with a beard, she's wearing blue blazer, white top, brown hair.

props.synopsis: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has been accused of "using her position" to "promote" her defamation of Central Land Council CEO Lesley Turner, on the final day of the Federal Court civil defamation trial.

title.children: Senator accused of 'using her position' to defame land council boss

image.altText: A man wearing blue scrubs stands in an operating room

props.synopsis: An emergency doctor has told an inquest into the death of an Alice Springs mother of three the tragedy "would not have happened" in Queensland and could have been avoided.

title.children: Doctor shocked by 'extremely high' sedative doses before mother's death

image.altText: CDP participant at Crowhurst

props.synopsis: Three Aboriginal Northern Territory councils say they will cancel leases critical to the rollout of the federal government's new jobs program after they claim they were overlooked for funding because they were "not Aboriginal enough".

title.children: 'The final straw': Remote councils threaten to disrupt $2.6b remote jobs program

image.altText: A montage of images including the back of a person and two newspaper clippings, one with a headline about "fondle claims".

props.synopsis: Victims of a paedophile who used children's artwork to hide abuse are suing the Victorian Education Department, alleging his abuse should have been stopped earlier.

title.children: Victims say paedophile teacher groomed them to believe students were his 'wives'

image.altText: A wide shot of a brick building, tin roof, with front sign reading 'Holy Spirit Church, slightly obstructed by green bushes

props.synopsis: Police charge a 38-year-old man who allegedly stabbed a Darwin priest in the face with a pen while he was setting up for evening mass.

title.children: Man charged after Darwin priest stabbed in face with pen while setting up for mass

image.altText: A person's hands are illuminated by the pale glow of a computer screen, as they type in a dark room.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has moved to restrict Freedom of Information request laws which, if passed, would block an environment group's long-running attempt to seek historic documents.

title.children: NT bill attempts to shield backbenchers from Freedom of Information laws

image.altText: A little girl on the beach wearing a cap and pink top

props.synopsis: The family of a 22-month-old girl who died at a Northern Territory child care centre last year are calling on the government to ban the type of fencing that caused her death under the banner of "Ebony's Law".

title.children: Toddler's family call for 'Ebony's Law' after childcare centre death

image.altText: A man photographed  from behind, watching horse racing on pub TV screens.

props.synopsis: Three weeks after an ABC investigation raised allegations against the NT's gambling commission, the government is refusing to answer straightforward questions about what's being done – if anything.

title.children: Five simple questions the NT government won't answer after Four Corners

image.altText: A grey US Navy ship docked at a port

props.synopsis: Venezuela says it has thwarted what it calls a CIA-linked plot to attack a US warship anchored in Trinidad.

title.children: Venezuela says mercenaries' arrests thwarted CIA 'false flag' attack on US warship

image.altText: Pat Conroy at the dispatch box.

props.synopsis: The defence industry minister says the federal government is fighting to keep the struggling Tomago smelter open, and has declared every option is being considered to save the facility. Follow live.

title.children: Labor declares 'nothing is off the table' in talks over Tomago smelter bailout

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: PM showed a 'profound failure of judgment' for wearing Joy Division T-shirt
Exclusive: First NZYQ cohort member deported to Nauru
Labor MPs quiz minister over details of environment reforms

image.altText: A woman smiling and taking a selfie.

props.synopsis: In a rarely-seen move, a Victorian judge halts proceedings in the Supreme Court to hold a minute's silence for a domestic violence murder victim.

title.children: Lachlan Young stares blankly during minute's silence for Hannah McGuire

image.altText: An aerial shot of Nauru.

props.synopsis: Australia could end up paying the tiny island nation about $2.5 billion over three decades if the more than 350 former detainees are successfully resettled.

title.children: First NZYQ cohort member deported to Nauru under opaque deal

image.altText: Cricketer wearing a helmet, standing next to the Australian flag, watching the game

props.synopsis: Australia wicketkeeper Alex Carey says he wants to be part of more Ashes history, after being central to one of the most infamous moments during the previous series.

title.children: Carey at peace with Ashes history after controversial Bairstow stumping

image.altText: Nicole kidman with old hollywood glamour curls and a strapless black gown

props.synopsis: From a Nicole Kidman "revenge" dress to a dressing-gown tuxedo, these are all of the best Hollywood-style looks at this year's Vogue World event.

title.children: Nicole Kidman opens Vogue World in Gilda gown weeks after divorce filing

image.altText: Big red ship docked in water

props.synopsis: The operator of Tasmania's ferry fleet told the state-owned operator of ports, "They're our ships, we know what we're doing", before botching design specifications, an inquiry has heard.

title.children: 'We know what we're doing': Ferry operator doubled down before $9m blunder

image.altText: A range of firearms sitting on a table.

props.synopsis: Almost three decades after Australia's worst-ever mass shooting, the total number of firearms in the country is the highest it has ever been but the surge in illegal guns is not due to 3D-printed weapons or black-market imports from overseas.

title.children: Guns being stolen and stripped down to be sold on the black market

image.altText: A man types on a laptop computer which is resting on his lap. The backround is lit with red light.

props.synopsis: Paedophiles are using the dark web to share information about how to gain access to childcare centres to sexually abuse babies and toddlers while avoiding getting caught.

title.children: On the dark web, predators are 'hunting in packs' to target childcare

image.altText: Richard White stands in front of office windows, with rooftops and trees visible behind him

props.synopsis: WiseTech says it was required to produce documents related to alleged trading in WiseTech shares by controversial co-founder Richard White and three employees from late 2024 to early 2025.

title.children: WiseTech shares crash after AFP and ASIC raid office

image.altText: Britain’s King Charles reacts by holding his hand up to his head

props.synopsis: The protester outside the cathedral could also be heard saying "have you asked the police to cover up for Andrew, sir?"

title.children: King Charles heckled with 'how long have you known?' about Prince Andrew

image.altText: Woman with curly hair and eyeglasses reading or texting using mobile phone in the living room.

props.synopsis: An expert says it can be lonely caring for or supporting someone living with a dependence or addiction.

title.children: What loving someone with an addiction or dependence can look like

image.altText: NRL player walking along the wing during a night match

props.synopsis: South Sydney's Tyrone Munro faces being sidelined for at least the start of next season, after being stood down by the NRL while facing domestic violence charges.

title.children: NRL stands down South Sydney Rabbitohs winger Tyrone Munro

image.altText: Penguins near Casey Station

props.synopsis: A document linked to the arrest of a scientist has raised questions about whether Russia has long-term ambitions to exploit oil resources in Antarctica, where mining is banned indefinitely.

title.children: Russia's interest in Antarctic oil exposed after scientist's arrest

image.altText: A man in a suit outside of a court house.

props.synopsis: A Victorian Magistrate says he has not been convinced that Thomas Sewell's behaviour during a 2023 Neo-Nazi rally in Ballarat was offensive.

title.children: Thomas Sewell found not guilty of offensive behaviour by Victorian court

image.altText: Aerial shot of mine

props.synopsis: Authorities are waiting for a mine to be made safe before they retrieve the body of a man who is one of two workers killed in an explosion at a western NSW mine.

title.children: Worker's body remains underground after fatal mine blast

image.altText: Older man and woman smiling on beach

props.synopsis: Life as the caretaker of a tropical island includes gardening and plenty of birdwatching, but the job is not all glamorous.

title.children: From off-grid to offshore, meet the couple being paid to care for a Qld tropical island

image.altText: Chris Dawson seated in a row of people.

props.synopsis: Gathering on sacred land where their ancestors were slain in one of the most brutal attacks on Aboriginal people in Western Australia, Traditional Owners hear the word it took almost 200 years to say — "sorry".

title.children: 'Still trying to process it': Tears as WA governor apologises for Pinjarra Massacre

image.altText: A woman smiles looks solemnly into the distance.

props.synopsis: Canberra Liberals leader Leanne Castley has immediately suspended Elizabeth Lee and Peter Cain from the party room, and is seeking to remove them permanently.

title.children: Elizabeth Lee and Peter Cain suspended from Canberra Liberals party room

image.altText: Tyler Robinson standing against grey wall.

props.synopsis: A US judge has agreed Tyler Robinson's case has drawn "extraordinary" public and media attention.

title.children: Suspect in Charlie Kirk killing can wear street clothes in court

image.altText: Close up of grey-suited real estate auctioneer holding a wooden hammer and folded papers.

props.synopsis: Whether or not we're delivered a rate cut next Tuesday, there's a solid argument that the RBA should once again consider using its powers to curb runaway real estate prices.

title.children: Why the RBA should put a handbrake on property prices

image.altText: A montage of images including the back of a person and two newspaper clippings, one with a headline about "fondle claims".

props.synopsis: Victims of a paedophile who used children's artwork to hide abuse are suing the Victorian Education Department, alleging his abuse should have been stopped earlier.

title.children: Victims say paedophile teacher groomed them to believe students were his 'wives'

image.altText: Richard Marles and Pat Conroy press conference

props.synopsis: A group of Pacific nations created to respond to humanitarian catastrophes will have an expanded remit, including "stabilisation" missions.

title.children: Australia to form part of Pacific 'taskforce' set to stir regional controversy

image.altText: Police officers testing drivers for cannabis near Nimbin

props.synopsis: The government says it was "investigating" a medical defence for drivers prescribed cannabis but ruled out the use of sniffer dogs and strip searches for suspected drug possession at music festivals in its response to last year's drug summit.

title.children: Medical cannabis defence for NSW drivers rejected for now

image.altText: Shane Chelepy in uniform.

props.synopsis: Queensland Police Service Deputy Commissioner Shane Chelepy is praised for seeing the state through times of disaster during his 40-year career.

title.children: One of Queensland's top cops announces retirement after 40 years

image.altText: a shutdown nuclear power plant in iowa

props.synopsis: Google has announced a nuclear facility shuttered in 2020 will return to service in 2029 to help power its "growing cloud and AI infrastructure in Iowa", a year after Microsoft signed on to reopen Three Mile Island.

title.children: Google, Microsoft to reopen old nuclear plants to power AI infrastructure

image.altText: A graphic of a young unidentified girl sitting on a chair, her face down, in a Family Court waiting room.

props.synopsis: Sally's legal battle in the Federal Circuit and Family Court of Australia may be years long gone, but the trauma of the experience lingers — especially on her eldest child.

title.children: Kids left powerless in 'disgusting custody battles' at Family Court
